intro: Tittmannia trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy tittmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are covered in fine, hairy structures, which help reduce water loss in cold, harsh environments. Its flowers are typically pink or white and bloom in the summer months. Tittmannia trichotoma plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for arctic wildlife.
